column1: #Text=Two types of devices have been used on a laboratory scale.
#Text=In the first type the web alone or provided with a felt or wire on one side is impacted by means of a pendulum against a hot surface.
#Text=When the pendulum bounces back, the web separates from the hot surface.
#Text=In the device of the second type, the wet web alone or provided with a felt or wire on one side is pressed between two heated plates in a plane press.
#Text=It is clear that neither of these methods for press drying on a laboratory scale can be developed into a press drying method for full-size, fast production machines operating continuously.
#Text=It has been considered possible to alter a press providing a press nip between conventional rolls so that the roll contacting the webs heated from inside, e.g. by condensing steam or hot oil.
#Text=In practice this method would, however, suffer from the drawback that the web passes through the press nip in about 1-5 milliseconds.
#Text=Though in press drying conditions the drying rate is very high, the web cannot be thoroughly heated to the desired temperature of more than 100.degree.
#Text=Between the nips the web cools again if it is not surrounded by steam.

#Text=The purpose of this invention is to obtain a method which eliminates the above-mentioned disadvantages and allows press drying to be carried out as a continuous process under production conditions.

#Text=This purpose is achieved according to the invention by means of a method characterized in that the temperature of the liquid used for cooling the cooled surface is maintained at least during a part of the cooling step above 100.degree.
#Text=C. and the pressure at least at such a level that the liquid is prevented from boiling.
#Text=By means of the method according to the invention desirable characteristics caused by press drying can be obtained in a web dried in a single pass during a normal web manufacturing process.
